[[Category:Transcendence Encyclopedia]]

revision.comment: Created page with 'Dark matter is defined as any kind of matter that is composed of supersymmetric particles (i.e., particles beyond the Standard Model menagerie of quarks, leptons, etc.) Dark mat…'
revision.text:
Dark matter is defined as any kind of matter that is composed of supersymmetric particles (i.e., particles beyond the Standard Model menagerie of quarks, leptons, etc.)
Dark matter interacts only weakly with the electromagnetic force and the nuclear-weak force.
There are four kinds of dark matter: dark acid, dark steel, dark lightning and dark fire.
Human technology is too primitive to manipulate dark matter.
[[Category:Transcendence Encyclopedia]]

revision.comment: Created page with 'A death cube is the mnemonic imprint of a dead person (we know the person is dead because the technology requires a destructive read of the cerebral network). Transferring the me…'
revision.text:
A death cube is the mnemonic imprint of a dead person (we know the person is dead because the technology requires a destructive read of the cerebral network). Transferring the memories of a recently deceased loved-one was a common ritual in the last century, but fell into disrepute after moral questions were raised—particularly after it was revealed that some vestige of consciousness survived in the death cube.
[[Category:Transcendence Encyclopedia]]

The Death Drugs Cartel sells the genetically tailored drugs needed for hyper-clonal therapy, a life-prolongation treatment. The drugs, which must be created specifically for an individual’s genome, were outlawed in the twenty-third century (in the middle of the [[Syrtis War]]) because their manufacture involves the growth and exploitation of a genetically altered, ancephalic clone. Though unavailable to the general [[Commonwealth]], it is well-known that most people of wealth and power use these drugs to prolong their life.
No one knows how long a human life may be extended using this therapy, but many people believe that the original creators of death drugs are still alive and are running the Cartel. If so, they would be over two-hundred years old.
== Organization == The Death Drugs Cartel is led by the secretive [[Cartel Directorate]], which is said to reside in a hidden station inside of [[Human Space]]. The Directorate controls five regions, each region organized by a Cartel Lieutenant in a well-defended stronghold. The Lieutenant has control over the labs and distribution networks for each star system in the region. Individual base commanders has jurisdiction over specific stations and labs.
== See Also == * [[Death Drugs Cartel (reference)]]
{{TEC}}

After the defeat of the [[Syrtis Conclave]], the remains of the Ares Sect moved out to the [[Outer Realm]] to rebuild their empire. Using cloning and genetic engineering they have become a major power in a little over a century.
The capital of the Ares Orthodoxy is the planet [[New Syrtis]] in the [[Aeria]] star system, one of the only biosphere planets in [[Human Space]].
== See Also == * [[Ares War]] * [[Ares Orthodoxy (reference)]]
{{TEC}}

The current war between the [[Commonwealth]] and the [[Ares Orthodoxy]] is known as the Ares War. The war began in the 2340s and has seen periods of intense fighting amid many years of relative calm. Since 2416, the Ares have begun a new wave of attacks and both sides have intensified the pace of operations.
== History of the Ares War == The war began in early 2342 as both Ares colonies and Commonwealth settlers claimed the same systems in the [[Outer Realm]]. Negotiations between Commonwealth and Ares failed after a few months and Ares ships began attacking Commonwealth settlements. Throughout the 2340s, the Commonwealth evacuated several settlements in the disputed area while simultaneously building up its military capabilities.
In 2352, the Commonwealth stronghold of [[Point Vesta]] was completed in a disputed system near Ares space. [[Point Ceres]], [[Point Pallas]], and [[Point Juno]] were completed in other systems over the next five years. In 2353, the first [[Commonwealth star carrier]], the [[CSC Europa]] was launched and deployed to the war zone. Eleven more star carriers were built and deployed by 2357.
In 2372 and ’73, the Ares responded to this Commonwealth build-up by launching a massive attack using their (then new) Cometfall missileships. The attack failed to overcome the Commonwealth Fleet, but the Ares did destroy Point Vesta in 2372 and two star carriers in 2373.
For more than forty years after 2373, the Ares War remained stalemated. Occasional battles flared in the disputed zone, but few systems turned. The Ares used these years to build up their fleet; their new Phobos-class dreadnoughts are generally considered to be superior to the aging CSCs.
In 2416 a new wave of Ares attacks began with a surprise attack on Point Pallas. After a massive battle, reportedly involving eight Phobos dreadnoughts and four CSCs, Point Pallas was destroyed and the Commonwealth Fleet forced to retreat.
As of 2419, the Ares War has intensified further and unconfirmed reports suggest that Point Ceres and at least one more star carrier have been destroyed.
== Opposition to the War and the Rogue Fleet == In the late 2390s, various antiwar parties in Parliament rose in popularity. A plurality of people in [[St. Katharine’s]] and the [[New Beyond]] support a withdrawal of the Fleet from the [[Outer Realm]].
Opposition to the Ares among Commonwealth settlers in the Outer Realm remains strong, but support for the Fleet continues to drop.
In 2398 a group of Commonwealth captains rebelled against the Fleet leadership and formed the so-called [[Rogue Fleet]]. Rogue ships prey on Ares and Commonwealth colonies alike.
== See Also == * [[Ares Orthodoxy]] * [[Commonwealth Fleet]]
{{TEC}}

revision.comment: Created page with 'The transcendent entity known as Domina inhabits the [[Galactic Core]], yet her power and influence is felt throughout [[Human Space]]. {{TEC}}'
revision.text:
The transcendent entity known as Domina inhabits the [[Galactic Core]], yet her power and influence is felt throughout [[Human Space]].
{{TEC}}

revision.comment: Created page with 'Duralloy is the tradename for a kind of regenerating steel. Duralloy consists of a precise blend of [[duranium]], titanium, and other exotic metals. The properties of this alloy …'
revision.text:
Duralloy is the tradename for a kind of regenerating steel. Duralloy consists of a precise blend of [[duranium]], titanium, and other exotic metals. The properties of this alloy are such that it is possible to lace it with nanomachines that can repair any damage or imperfection.
{{TEC}}

revision.comment: Created page with 'Dyons are subatomic particles with both an electric and magnetic charge. Ferromagnetic dust, activated by dyons, immunizes a ship against ion effects that can damage or disable t…'
revision.text:
Dyons are subatomic particles with both an electric and magnetic charge. Ferromagnetic dust, activated by dyons, immunizes a ship against ion effects that can damage or disable the ship’s systems.
{{TEC}}

revision.comment: Created page with 'The Earth Industries Conglomerate is a giant industrial, consumer goods, and military manufacturer based in [[St. Katharine’s Star]]. EI, as it is commonly known, is the larges…'
revision.text:
The Earth Industries Conglomerate is a giant industrial, consumer goods, and military manufacturer based in [[St. Katharine’s Star]]. EI, as it is commonly known, is the largest member of the [[Corporate Hierarchy]] by market capitalization.
== EI Weapons Division == This division is responsible for developing, manufacturing, and selling military equipment to sovereign entities and individuals.
EI weapons are generally competitive and of good quality, but seldom display innovation. They are best known for the following items:
* Bolide laser blaster * Laser cannon * [[Mining laser]] * [[TeV 9 blaster]] * Turbolaser cannon
{{TEC}}

revision.comment: Created page with 'Etherium is a rare ore with mysterious properties. Crystals of etherium are used to generate energy fields, such as those produced by shield generators. {{TEC}}'
Created page with 'This exquisite spice is made from a dried moss originally found on [[Europa]], the frozen Jovian moon. {{TEC}}'
revision.text:
This exquisite spice is made from a dried moss originally found on [[Europa]], the frozen Jovian moon.
{{TEC}}

revision.comment: Created page with 'Field crystals are used to moderate and sustain the force fields produced by shield generators. The kind of field crystal used affects the properties of the force field. For exa…'
Created page with 'Fission reactors work by splitting the nuclei of heavy atoms such as [[uranium]] and [[plutonium]]. The process generates heat (which can be converted to electricity). Fission r…'
Created page with 'The Freeworlds are a loose association of stations and individuals that attempt to stay out of the mainstream corporate world of the [[Commonwealth]]. With their own industries a…'
revision.text:
The Freeworlds are a loose association of stations and individuals that attempt to stay out of the mainstream corporate world of the [[Commonwealth]]. With their own industries and their own populations, the Freeworlds are independent enough that they do not participate in any of the economic structures of the [[Human Space]].
Philosophically, the Freeworlders have developed a blend of socialist and free market ideas that affirm individual rights over megacorporation hegemony. The moderate majority believes in co-existence with the rest of humanity and only conflicts with the Commonwealth over intellectual property rights (which the Freeworlders abhor). Nevertheless, there are radical elements (such as the [[Anarchists]]) who actively and violently seek to topple the [[Corporate Hierarchy]].
The most successful and the largest Freeworlds enterprise is the family-owned [[Revolution Designs Association]] which manufactures most everything from personal appliances to starships.
{{TEC}}

revision.comment: Created page with 'The Freeworlds Shipyard is a communal shipyard that also serves as the public gathering place for all [[Freeworlders]] involved in space activities. Though mostly used by individ…'
revision.text:
The Freeworlds Shipyard is a communal shipyard that also serves as the public gathering place for all [[Freeworlders]] involved in space activities. Though mostly used by individuals to repair and retrofit their starships, the Freeworlds Shipyard also has a manufacturing plant run by the [[Revolution Designs Association]] that produces many good quality starships.
== Shuttle and Transport Designs == The vast majority of ships built by the Freeworlds Shipyard are small shuttles and transports. The following are some of the most common designs:
* [[Earthzone class shuttle]] * Freespace 350 starrider (personal shuttle) * Freespace 750 starrider (high-performance shuttle) * Solidarity R5 transport * Solidarity T51 light freighter
== Armed Ship Designs == Although Revolution Designs does not create nor endorse any military designs, many people have created modifications that include weapons and shields. All of the above designs have armed variants.
{{TEC}}

revision.comment: Created page with 'Fusion reactors generate energy by fusing light atoms such as hydrogen and helium to generate heat (which can be converted to electricity). Fusion power is still the most common…'
Created page with 'Gamma Crucis is a red giant star eighty-eight light-years from [[Earth]]. Astronomers are interested in it because it is emitting more gamma rays than standard stellar models pre…'
revision.text:
Gamma Crucis is a red giant star eighty-eight light-years from [[Earth]]. Astronomers are interested in it because it is emitting more gamma rays than standard stellar models predict.
{{TEC}}

revision.comment: Created page with 'The [[Ancient Races]] use a form of gravitic energy to power their machines and starships. Theoretically, gravitic energy, which powers quasars and black holes, is almost limitle…'
revision.text:
The [[Ancient Races]] use a form of gravitic energy to power their machines and starships. Theoretically, gravitic energy, which powers quasars and black holes, is almost limitless in power. Harnessing this power, however, requires the technologies to manipulate mass, inertia, and the fabric of space—none of which are available to humans.
{{TEC}}

revision.comment: Created page with 'This rare resource was originally created in the Big Bang and cannot be replenished. It is used today as a fuel for [[zero-point energy]] generators. {{TEC}}'
revision.text:
This rare resource was originally created in the Big Bang and cannot be replenished. It is used today as a fuel for [[zero-point energy]] generators.
{{TEC}}

The Sung Slavers are an advanced but mysterious civilization that inhabits the [[Ungoverned Territories]]. They enslave humans of all races and use them for organ transplants, drug manufacture, and processing power.
Sung Slavers are particularly skilled at cyber technology and there are some who believe that they have an alliance with [[Luminous]].
== See Also == * [[Sung Slavers (reference)]]
{{TEC}}

Carbosilicate creatures are composed of rock and crystal. Their biology is based on silicon, often using decaying radioiosotopes for power. These lifeforms generally have slow metabolisms and very long life spans, although some species evolved a much higher metabolism fueled by nanofission reactions.
== Evolution == Carbosilicate lifeforms evolved on a single volcano world and spread out into the rest of the galaxy in the second orbis.
== See Also == * [[Domain (exobiology)]]
{{TEC}}

The Ferroelectric domain of lifeforms encompasses all species that use metal and electrical circuits for their function.
== Evolution == None of the species in this domain evolved naturally, but in the first orbis several other domains created self-replicating metallic creatures. Since then, most Ferroelectic species have evolved independently of their creators.
== See Also == * [[Domain (exobiology)]]
{{TEC}}

This domain of life encompasses species that evolved on hydrogen gas giants.
== Evolution == These lifeforms evolved on two or three different worlds independently. One species is believed to be the first to have evolved intelligence in the galaxy (and galactic dates are now measured from that point).
== See Also == * [[Domain (exobiology)]]
{{TEC}}

The Monomorphia domain encompasses lifeforms that form massive colonies of fungi-like organism.
== Evolution == Several worlds independently evolved species in this domain, but only one reached intelligence.
== See Also == * [[Domain (exobiology)]]
{{TEC}}

The Nebular domain encompasses lifeforms that evolved and inhabit deep space nebulae.
== Evolution == Very little is known about this domain; there are very few members. But most believe that they evolved in some of the primordial gas clouds of the early galaxy. Some members of the Nebular domain claim that they developed intelligence before the Hydrogenia domain, but there is no hard proof.
== See Also == * [[Domain (exobiology)]]
{{TEC}}

The Neutronia domain encompasses lifeforms that evolved and inhabit high-gravity zones such as neutron stars.
== Evolution == This domain evolved and developed intelligence on a single star and has since colonized many of the degenerate stars in the galaxy.
== See Also == * [[Domain (exobiology)]]
{{TEC}}

The Oxygenia domain encompasses all lifeforms that are carbon-based and breathe oxygen, including humans.
== Evolution == This is the most abundant and common domain. Many planets in the galaxy developed carbon-based, oxygen-breathing life (including Earth). Consequently, there are dozens of branches in this domain.
== See Also == * [[Domain (exobiology)]]
{{TEC}}

The Photosynthic domain encompasses lifeforms that use photosynthesis as their power source (including Earth plants).
== Evolution == Like Oxygenia, this domain has abundant examples throughout the galaxy. Only a single species ever evolved intelligence, however, and all Photosynthic civilizations descent from them.
== See Also == * [[Domain (exobiology)]]
{{TEC}}

The Transcendent [[Domain (exobiology)|domain]] is one of the highest classifications of lifeforms in the galaxy. Transcendent species are those that are primarily composed of non-baryonic matter and that possess a hyper-intelligence and hyper-consciousness.
[[Oracus]] and [[Domina]] are members of this domain.
== Evolution == The mysteries of this domain are lost along with the [[Halo Races]]. It is not known whether the Halo Races were themselves members of this domain.
== See Also == * [[Domain (exobiology)]]
{{TEC}}

revision.comment: /* Habitable Planets */
revision.text:
Human Space is the term used to describe the group of human-populated star systems centered on [[Sol]] and contained within the quarantine zone established by the [[Ancient Races]].
The star systems of Human Space are commonly divided into regions, each one colonized in a different wave of human expansion. Humanity's first interstellar colonies in the dozen systems around Sol are known are the [[Near Stars]]. These systems, colonized in the first decades of the twenty-second century, include [[Centauri]], [[Sirius]], and [[Kibo]].
The discovery of a biosphere on a world in [[Saint Katharine's Star]] sparked a new wave of colonization. By the twenty-fourth century, after the devastation of [[Earth]] and [[Mars]] in the [[Syrtis War]], Saint Katharine’s had become the political center of Human Space.
As the Saint Katharine's colonies grew and developed, various groups pushed further out into the [[New Beyond]]. The [[Commonwealth]] colonies of [[Rigel Aurelius]] and [[Eridani]] were founded in the late twenty-second century.
Meanwhile, other groups leapfrogged the New Beyond and settled in the systems around [[Jiang's Star]]. The [[Huari]] settled in the early twenty-second century, but were later displaced by the [[Sung]] civilization. Since the twenty-fourth century, the Sung have claimed dozens of systems as [[Sung Space]]. The Commonwealth, which also has colonies in the region, disputes the claim and instead calls the systems the [[Ungoverned Territories]].
In the late twenty-second century, [[Ringers]] from [[Saturn]] colonized many systems beyond Sung Space. This region, now known as the [[Outer Realm]], has only a small Commonwealth presence. After the resurgence of the [[Ares]] however, the Outer Realm has become the main battleground for Commonwealth and Ares forces.
== Habitable Planets == * [[Earth]] * [[Incandescent]] * [[New Syrtis]]
{{TEC}}

The Huari Empire was once the supreme power in the [[Ungoverned Territories]], but the civilization of the [[Sung Slavers]] has displaced them.
The ancestors of the Huari settled in the [[Loriol system]] in the early 2120s. Later, they expanded into the surrounding systems and formed the Huari Empire.
The Huari are not as technologically advanced as the Sung—particularly with respect to cyber-technology. Nevertheless, their massive fortresses protect them from the Slavers.
== See Also == * [[Apotomo]] * [[Huaramarca]] * [[Sung Slavers]]
[[Category:Sovereign]] {{TEC}}

The Book of Patterns is an ancient database maintained by the [[Halo Races]]. It describes every form of technology and power known to the Halo Races. The Book of Patterns is constantly being updated and it is believed that much of human technology is described therein.
{{TEC}}

revision.comment: /* See Also */
revision.text:
The Corporate Hierarchy is older than the [[Commonwealth]]. It was founded originally in 2043 as a loose association of companies to coordinate the exploitation of space resources, but it has developed over the last few centuries into a fully functioning federated sovereign.
The members of the Hierarchy, known as shareholders, are all owners of shares in one of more corporations. Though nominally citizens of the Commonwealth, shareholders follow their own laws and processes when on private corporate territory. Though they are not obvert about it, shareholders think of themselves are superior (or at least luckier) than the average Commonwealth citizen.
Most shareholders own shares in a single corporation—generally the corporation in which they work. Transferring from one corporation to another is not unheard of, but it is about as difficult as moving from America to Europe was in the twentieth century. Most shareholders feel a strong loyalty to their corporation primarily.
== Leadership == Despite its name, the Corporate Hierarchy is extremely decentralized. Each corporation has a wide degree of autonomy in how it conducts its business. Each corporation is governed by a Board of Directors that is (generally) elected by the shareholders (with votes proportional to their shares).
Inter-corporate affairs, trading rules, and common security bylaws are decided by the Corporate Organizing Committee, which consists of a member from each chartered corporation (who has votes proportional to market capitalization).
A second body, the Corporate Executive Committee, wields the power to enforce laws and regulations between corporations and the power to enforce trade agreements and treaties with external entities.
The Corporate Executive Committee (CEC) is a small and secretive body consisting of some of the largest shareholders in the Hierarchy. The CEC consists of 17 members, but not all are publicly known, choosing to remain anonymous.
At least three and possibly as many as six current members of the CEC were alive at the original founding of the Hierarchy, more than 375 years ago.
== See Also == * [[List of corporations]] * [[Corporate Hierarchy (design notes)]]
{{TEC}}

Ringers are descended from the human outpost on [[Titan]], [[Saturn]]'s largest moon. Ringers have successfully modified themselves to be able to operate in the vacuum of space, typically inside a planetary ring or dense asteroid system.
In the 2180’s, Ringers unhappy with the economic situation in [[Sol]], began to colonize the [[Outer Realm]]. Today, only a small percentage of the Ringer population remain at Saturn.
Because of their adaptation to space, Ringers are expert and efficient miners and they supply heavy metals and radioactives to much of [[Human Space]].
[[Category:Sovereign]] {{TEC}}

The Syrtis Conclave originated on [[Mars]] during the twenty-second century. Their knowledge of genetic engineering and neural programming enabled them to create a population of neo-human clones. Over the many decades, the architects of the Conclave created a prosperous civilization free of dissent and division.
During the 2220's a sub-culture within the Conclave, known as the [[Ares Sect]], rose to power and assumed control over the entire Conclave. Guided by what they believed to be a divine intelligence in the [[Galactic Core]], the [[Ares]] waged war on Earth and the surrounding systems. After attacking and destroying various Commonwealth colonies, the Commonwealth organized a fleet to defeat the Ares. The [[Commonwealth Fleet]] succeeded in destroying the Ares fleet and nearly sterilized Mars from orbit with fusion weapons. The remaining survivors were driven out of the system.
Today the Ares have re-established their civilization in the [[Outer Realm]], and the Commonwealth Fleet continues to [[Ares War|fight]] them there. The Syrtis Conclave also remains as a nomadic diaspora that has small colonies in various human star systems. Even there, they tend to populate the outer asteroids or inhospitable worlds.
== See Also == * [[Ares Orthodoxy]] * [[Ares War]]
[[Category:Sovereign]] {{TEC}}

Taikon Ventures is a [[Edo]]-based corporation that explores uncharted systems looking for rare minerals and alien artifacts. Taikon Ventures has a reputation for being daring and for doing business in dangerous areas. They are one of the only corporations with stations in the [[Outer Realm]].
Taikon Ventures is the only company that manufactures and sells [[quadrocarbide]] (and its variants).
Taikon Ventures is controlled by [[Ren Taikon]], grandson of the original founder of the company.
[[Category:Sovereign]] {{TEC}}

Ren Taikon was born in 2374 in the [[Kitamura system]]. After the death of his mother, Kei, in 2394, he inherited sole control over [[Taikon Ventures]], a mining and resources exploration company.
In 2403, Taikon embarked on a well-publicized journey to the Galactic Core. Although he never left [[Human Space]], he returned with wondrous artifacts and tales, sufficient to continue funding his explorations.
[[Category:Character]] [[Category:Transcendence Encyclopedia|Taikon ren]] [[Category:Transcendence Ideas]]

Johann Amundsen was a miner and explorer who discovered many of the asteroids in the systems of the [[New Beyond]] and who gained immense power and wealth from his discovery of an alien data store.
He was born in 2163 and moved with his family to [[Starton Eridani]] when he was a teenager.
In 2221, on an expedition to a distant star system, he found a buried alien archive. Amundsen used the knowledge that he found inside to plan and execute several expeditions, each one further and further from [[Human Space]]. Each time he returned, he brought back fabulous riches and technologies. But he also returned altered—Amundsen had used the alien knowledge to enhance his ship and himself.
The last time that he returned, in 2229, he was almost unrecognizable. He had attained powers far beyond any human. A massive Commonwealth fleet was deployed to prevent Amundsen from getting too close to a populated area. He spoke for several days with high-level representatives and scientists of the Commonwealth, but the transcripts of those conversations were marked Highest Security and have to this date not been made public. A few days later he left Human Space and has not returned since.
[[Category:Character]] [[Category:Transcendence Encyclopedia|Amundsen johann]] [[Category:Transcendence Ideas]]

Aubrey is [[Lord Mikho]]'s personal assistant.
[[Category:Character]] [[Category:Transcendence Encyclopedia|Enderfeld aubrey]]

Mikho Evdorikov, known as Lord Mikho within the [[Sindikat]], is a high-ranking member of the [[Black Market]].
[[Category:Character]] [[Category:Transcendence Encyclopedia|Evdorikov mikho]]

Captain Helios commands the [[CSC Antarctica]].
[[Category:Character]] [[Category:Transcendence Encyclopedia|Helios regina]]

Raisu’s station master (her name is not revealed in the game) feels that her duty is to protect and defend the station residents against the Centauri warlords who threaten it. She hates the warlords, but she cooperates with them because they will otherwise harm the station. Many years ago, her husband (Jorgen Keene) defied the warlords and was killed (by [[Arco Vaughn]]) as an example. Nevertheless, if she could, she would side with anyone who would challenge and defeat the warlords.
[[Category:Character]] [[Category:Transcendence Encyclopedia|Keene erica]]

Colleen McMurray joined the [[Sisterhood]] over hundred years ago after the death of her husband and daughter. She is a member of the Circle of Obedience, the executive body of the Sisters, and is the abbess of a cathedral in the [[Ungoverned Territories]]. She is also the head of the [[Order of St. Josephine]], a sect that believes that a coming flame deluge will purge Humanity. Sister McMurray knows about the [[Iocrym]] plan to sterilize the region.
[[Category:Character]] [[Category:Transcendence Encyclopedia|McMurray colleen]] [[Category:Transcendence Ideas]]

Kate is [[Robert Morgental]]’s clone-daughter. She is over sixty years old, though she looks only thirty. She is one of her father’s representatives and she travels throughout the Commonwealth on his behalf.
[[Category:Character]] [[Category:Transcendence Encyclopedia|Morgental kate]]

Robert Morgental is hyper-wealthy shareholder who owns a few percent of several top 100 corporations. He is well-known by reputation, but very few people have ever met him. He is rumored to be at least 300 years old and kept alive by various sophisticated (and expensive) medical procedures and devices.
Morgental has been increasingly interested in the technology of the [[Iocrym]] and the [[Ancient Races]] in general.
[[Category:Character]] [[Category:Transcendence Encyclopedia|Morgental robert j]]

Anton is a wealthy, high-placed Corporate director who seeks to gain power. [[Oracus]] influences him and helps him on occasion. As the player gains more power, she may attract Anton’s attention. Whenever the player gains some powerful or unique technology, Anton will seek to acquire it (at a decent, but not generous price). If the player refuses, Anton may use other forms of persuasion. He may try to hurt the player by draining her credit or perhaps by blacklisting her from all Corporate stations. If that doesn’t work, he will send out bounty-hunters against her. As a last resort, if the prize is sufficient (e.g., an archcannon) then he will fight directly.
[[Category:Character]] [[Category:Transcendence Encyclopedia|Nasser anton]] [[Category:Transcendence Ideas]]

Juan Carlos is the captain of the Forking Paths, a modified EI500 freighter.
[[Category:Character]] [[Category:Transcendence Encyclopedia|Uribe juan carlos]]

The leader of the [[Centauri Warlords]] in the [[Eridani]] system, Arco Vaughn flies a modified heavy raider.
[[Category:Character]] [[Category:Transcendence Encyclopedia|Vaughn arco]]

General Maureen Verner is the commanding officer of [[Point Juno]]—the last remaining stronghold in the [[Ares War|war]] against the [[Ares Orthodoxy]].
Verner was born in the [[St. Katharine]] system in 2354. She joined the [[Commonwealth Fleet]] in 2385 after traveling in the [[Ungoverned Territories]] for several years.
[[Category:Character]] [[Category:Transcendence Encyclopedia|Verner maureen]]

Yuri Volkov is an elite pilot who flies for the [[Korolov Shipping Corporation]]. He flies a highly modified ''Wolfen''-class gunship.
Several years ago, Volkov’s wife, Helena, was called by [[Domina]] to the Core. She left him behind and he has been searching for her ever since. He has trained and earned money by defending freighters against pirates, and once he meets the player, he decides to follow her to the Core also, hoping to find Helena.
[[Category:Character]] [[Category:Transcendence Encyclopedia|Volkov yuri]]

revision.comment: /* See Also */
revision.text:
The Polyarny Shipyards are a massive space structure orbiting [[Ceres]] in the [[Sol System]]. Owned by the [[Makayev-Energia]] corporation, the shipyards have built many of the largest ships in [[Human Space]], including all the [[Antares freighter]] classes.
Construction at Polyarny began in 2263, only a few years after the end of the [[Syrtis War]]. The first shipyard was completed in 2266, and the first ship built there was launched in 2269.
== See Also == * [[Makayev-Energia Space Systems]] * [[Seven Wonders of Human Space]]
[[Category:Transcendence Encyclopedia]]

The Seven Wonders of Human Space are:
* [[Arcology of New Victoria]] * [[Ares Prime Arcology]] * [[Battle Arena Maximus]] * [[Cathedral of Domina]] * [[Concatenated Digital Metropolis]] * [[First Contact Monument]] * [[Polyarny Shipyards]]
[[Category:Transcendence Encyclopedia]] [[Category:Transcendence Ideas]]

This is a list of the members of the [[Corporate Hierarchy]]. They are listed in descending order of total revenue:
# '''[[Earth Industries Conglomerate]]''': A massive manufacturing conglomerate. OmniDefense systems is a subsidiary. # '''[[High Energy Resources]]''': Mining, refining, and processing of fuels. # '''[[North Atlantic Manufacturing Industries]]''': Manufacturer. # '''[[Oceana]]''': The largest retailer in the Commonwealth. # '''[[Credit Commonwealth]]''': A banking and financial services group. # '''[[Honoku-Tomashi Keiretsu]]''': A conglomerate manufacturer of consumer goods, industrial equipment, and space systems (including military). Bushido and Kabuto Defense are subsidiaries. # '''[[Clavius Insurance Conglomerate]]''': Insurance, investments, and financial services. # '''[[Orbitalis]]''': A multi-station property owner. # '''[[Pacific Defense Corporation]]''': A military-industrial manufacturer. # '''[[Axon Interstellar Networks]]''': A data communications and delivery company. # '''[[Solcom Energy]]''': A producer of fusion fuel. # '''[[Makayev-Energia Space Systems]]''': A heavy-industries manufacturer. # '''[[Biosphere Energies]]''': Supplier of energy and oxygen. # '''[[Thalmann]]''': A financial services company. # '''[[Assembler Corporation]]''': A manufacturer of exotic materials. # '''[[CommonBank]]''': A bank and financial services company. # '''[[NeuroSoft]]''': A manufacturer and retailer of digital and neural consumer goods and software. # '''[[Marina-Maxwell Foods]]''': A food processing giant. # '''[[Astralus Biotech]]''': A medical sciences conglomerate. # '''[[Imaginarium]]''': An entertainment conglomerate. Producer of entertainment software (“Exile Starport”) and hardware (“Microsaurs”) # '''[[Korolov Shipping]]''': A shipping and transportation company. # '''[[Reich & Balham]]''': A consumer goods company. # '''[[Jorrell Scientific]]''': An agricultural technology manufacturer. # '''[[Rasiermesser]]''': A small, but innovative weapons manufacturer. # '''[[Blue Planet Stuff]]''': A clothing and consumer goods company. # '''[[Taikon Ventures]]''': A mining and explorations corporation (also a manufacturer of star ship systems). # '''[[Hyperspace Networks]]''': A manufacturer of data communications and networking systems. # '''[[Saint Eugenia Medical Systems]]''': A manufacturer of medical products. # '''[[Senpaku Hogei]]''': A food processing conglomerate. Makers of Hogei Salmon. # '''[[Zubrin Systems]]''': A manufacturer and retailer of luxury space vessels. # '''[[Infinity Group]]''': An educational services corporation. # '''[[Colliseum Games]]''': Owner and operator of the [[Battle Arena Maximus]]. # '''[[Tenhove Defense Systems]]''': A manufacturer of security equipment. # '''[[Cloud9]]''': A liquor and drinks producer (creator of Venusian Hellas run and Red Nebula beer). # '''[[Shennong Pharmaceuticals]]''': A drugs manufacturer. # '''[[Severstal Khan]]''': A manufacturer of starship components. # '''[[Solon Industries]]''': A manufacturer of space systems.
{{TEC}} [[Category:Transcendence Reference]]

revision.text:

== [[New Beyond]] == * [[Charon]] * [[Eridani]] * [[Rigel Aurelius]] * [[St. Katharine's Star]]

{{TEC}} {{TRC}}

revision.comment: Created page with 'Kitamura is a star system of the [[Near Stars]] around [[Sol]]. [[Ren Taikon]] was born in this system. {{TEC}}'

revision.text:
Urak is a star system a few gates away from [[Sol]]. It is member of the [[Near Stars]].
== History == In 2194, the Urak system was colonized by Russian exiles from [[Earth]] and [[Luna]]. The colonies prospered in the first half of the twenty-third century, mostly on the strength of [[ceralloy]] prices.
In 2247, an outbreak of [[phobos aerium]] decimated the population. With many other systems occupied by war, few were able to help the Urak and the system descended into chaos.
In 2276, one warlord clan triumphed over the others and imposed a strict military order in the system.
== See Also == * [[Urak Warlords]]
{{TEC}}

revision.text:
The Near Stars include the set of systems closest to [[Sol]] and just before [[St. Katharine's Star]] on one end and [[Jiang's Star]] on the other.
The [[Kuiper gate]] connects [[Sol]] to the [[Centauri system]]. Another stargate in Centauri leads to a chain of systems including [[Kibo]], [[Urak]], and terminating at [[St. Katharine's]]. A third stargate leads from Centauri to [[Jiang's Star]] via [[Sirius]] and [[Kitamura]].
== See Also == * [[Human Space]]
{{TEC}}

revision.comment: /* Selected Civilizations */
revision.text:
This article is about the origins for the civilizations of the Galaxy.
In the history of the Galaxy seventeen species independently evolved intelligence and civilization. Every one of the thousands of civilizations in the Galaxy emerged from one of those seventeen. No one knows which one was first to emerge--the history of the first civilizations are lost in time. The most recent emergence, the seventeenth species, is humanity.
== Selected Civilizations ==
* [[Aestari]]: A [[nebular]] species.
* [[Kr'koa]]: A [[carbosilicate]] species, now believed extinct. ** [[Duor'crym]] ** [[Iokoa]] *** [[Iocrym]] **** [[Rho'hahn]]: A [[ferroelectric]] species, created as servant warriors. **** [[Fial'hahn]]: A [[ferroelectric]] species, created as servants.
* Carbosilicate II * [[F001]] (Foe-one): A [[hydrogenia (domain)|hydrogenia]] species, now extinct. ** [[F005]] (Foe-five) *** [[20A6 F005]] (A-six) **** [[0690 20A6 F005]] (Oh-six): A [[devolved beast]]. **** [[20B9 20A6 F005]] (B-nine): A [[ferroelectric]] species created by A6. *** [[20ED F005]] (Ee-dee) **** [[FFFF F005]] (Efreet) ** [[F011]] (Foe-eleven) ** [[F019]] (Foe-nineteen)
* [[Oremuleeole]]: A [[hydrogenia (domain)|hydrogenia]] species. ** [[Oleanleeole]] ** [[Illianloo]]: A foundation. *** [[Uloollianloo]]: A neutronian species. *** [[Illianhule]]
* [[Juton]]: A [[hydrogenia (domain)|hydrogenia]] species that evolved on the same planet as [[Oremuleeole]]. ** [[Jax]]: A hunter-killer species.
* Hydrogen giant IV
* Monomorph I ** [[Hael]]: A clonal colony that feeds on high-energy radiation and can control some kinds of nervous systems.
* Neutronian I
* [[Majellen progenitor]]: Though the evidence is inconclusive, there are hints that a progenitor race preceeded the Majellens. ** [[Majellen]]: One of the first galactic civilizations, now extinct.
* [[Ctoron progenitor]] ** [[Ctoron]]: An ancient species of oxygen breathers, now extinct. *** [[Cenotrope]]: One of the most traditional species; guardians of Domina and Oracus. *** [[Tesiphon]]: An uplifter race that left colonies all over the galaxy. **** [[Tesiphon Archipelago]]: A collection of races, all uplifed by the Tesiphon. Includes: Coelac, Elder, Fael, Helo, Liam, Mu, and Palemon. **** [[Grome]]: Uplifed by the Tesiphon, but rebeled and now are a savage empire. *** [[Somaton]]: A mysterious race. **** [[Cryson]]: A sterilizer species (created by the Somatons, but now disowned). ** [[Voraton]]: An ancient species, now extinct *** [[Xon Caol]]: A perversion.
* Oxygen breather III
* Oxygen breather IV ** [[Wo Daazhen]]: An [[oxygenia]] species. *** [[Daazhen]]: Descendants of the Wo Daazhen, who created one of the first interstellar empires. **** [[Erebien]] **** [[Tor Quan]]: The main competitor of the Erebien. **** [[Zhen Ma]]: An introspective race. ** [[Gou Zhen]]: A mysterious, extinct race *** [[Mu Nai]]: A savage collective.
* Oxygen breather V ** [[Blue-Brightness]]: An ancient ocean species. *** [[Steadfast-Harvester]] *** [[Underdark-Keeper]]: A savage cryptologue species.
* [[Anunnaki]] (extinct after [[Oracus War]])
* [[Human]]: An [[oxygenia]] species, recently emerged. ** [[Ares]] ** [[Ringer]] *** [[Teraton]]
* [[Oduduwa progenitor]]: This race is lost in the mists of time. ** [[Oduduwa]]: A [[photosynthic]] species. ** [[Onawa]]: A perversion, now extinct. *** [[Reenu]]: A savage species that expands relentlessly. *** [[Onawa Trome]]: A photosynthic hunter species.
== See Also == * [[Ancient Races]] * [[Galactic timeline]]
{{TEC}}

The term ''Ancient Races'' refers to the civilizations that currently inhabit the galactic disk.
== History == At the end of the [[Galactic Civil War]] the surviving species agreed that unchecked growth (both in numbers and in technology) was unsustainable. [[Oracus]] and [[Domina]] restricted the powers of each species to a well-defined limit. Furthermore, every species was responsible for limiting its use of energy, which required each to implement reproductive controls and enforce a limited lifespan.
To safeguard this new peace and to enforce the limits, Oracus and Domina chose individuals from each species and gave them special powers, including immortality. These individuals are known as [[Archons]] and they were chosen and created to both represent and to control the particular species they came from.
== Domains == Like all lifeforms in the galaxy, the Ancient Races belong to one of the nine [[domains of life]]:
* [[Carbosilicate (domain)|Carbosilicate]]: rock and crystalline creatures. * [[Ferroelectric (domain)|Ferroelectric]]: cybernetic and metallic lifeforms. * [[Hydrogenia (domain)|Hydrogenia]]: large, gas giant inhabitants. * [[Monomorphia]]: massive single organisms similar to fungi. * [[Nebular (domain)|Nebular]]: rarefied beings consisting of interacting dust motes in nebulae. * [[Neutronia]]: hyperdense organisms living on white dwarfs and neutron stars. * [[Oxygenia]]: carbon-based, oxygen breathers, human-scale. * [[Photosynthic]]: photosynthetic life. * [[Transcendent (domain)|Transcendent]]: non-baryonic lifeforms like Domina and Oracus.
== Aspects & Alignments == Each of the Ancient Races has its own philosophy, heritage, and culture. Each values different things and each strives for different things. While each species is unique, it is possible to categorize them. Each species can be rated along three ''aspects'':
* community vs. independence * knowledge vs. spirituality * evolution vs. tradition
From these axes we can construct eight [[alignments]] that correspond to various combinations of the aspects:
* [[Republic]] (community, knowledge, evolution): Republics are often homogenous civilizations with a well-defined hierarchical government. They value knowledge, reason, and facts, but they acknowledge that nothing stays the same and continually try to improve themselves.
* [[Federation]] (community, knowledge, tradition): These civilizations, often composed of diverse peoples, have achieved balance and peace over several millenia. They rely on their great stores of knowledge to guide their decisions and they tend to be suspicious of innovation because of the risk of unintended consequences.
* [[Uplifter]] (community, spirituality, evolution): Uplifter civilizations believe in continuously improving themselves and those around them. Their sacred mission is to make the universe better for all its sentient beings. Their one flaw is that they sometimes lack patience.
* [[Foundation]] (community, spirituality, tradition): Foundations strive to be selfless civilizations that support the development of others. They are like the solid core around which a gas giant forms. Foundations preserve the infrastructure, keep the peace, maintain trade, and otherwise serve to bind other civilizations together.
* [[Competitor]] (independence, knowledge, evolution): Competitor civilizations idealize the individual who competes, excels, and triumphs. They value the process of competition almost more than the result. Anywhere in the universe is home for these beings and the only thing they fear is boredom.
* [[Archivist]] (independence, knowledge, tradition): Archivists value the accumulation and dissemination of knowledge. The hard-won insights of long-dead races hold more interest to these civilizations than either conquest or treasure.
* [[Seeker]] (independence, spirituality, evolution): These civilizations are composed of diverse individuals who worship open-mindedness and questioning. Through art, philosophy and religion, Seekers strive to give meaning and sense to a cold and irrational universe.
* [[Hermit]] (independence, spirituality, tradition): Hermit civilizations concentrate on the simplicity of existing. They believe that desire leads to obsession which leads to unhappiness. Only by accepting the universe as it is can an intelligent creature be truly enlightened.
All of the above civilizations are ''constructive'' in that they generally coexist with each other peacefully. There are, however, ''destructive'' versions of all the above that are corrupted or extremist. Destructive civilizations are not uncommon, but they are often contained to certain regions or otherwise managed.
The destructive alignments are:
* [[Collective]] (corrupted republic): Taken to an extreme, a homogenous society can become an unthinking mass controlled by a central ruler.
* [[Empire]] (corrupted federation): Whereas federations are voluntary associations of diverse groups, empires seek to conquer and expand.
* [[Sterilizer]] (corrupted uplifter): Sterilizers and uplifters have a similar goal: to create a better universe. Sterilizers destroy flawed cultures rather than help to improve them.
* [[Corrector]] (corrupted foundation): While foundations support civilization, correctors can stifle it. Correctors impose their own byzantine rules, regulations, and mores on all.
* [[Megalomaniac]] (corrupted competitor): The dark side of competion leads to this alignment, in which belief in superiority leads to destructive ends.
* [[Cryptologue]] (corrupted archivist): Cryptologues horde knowledge and use it to achieve their own dark goals. They often prevent the dissemination of knowledge to others.
* [[Perversion]] (corrupted seeker): Unbound by logic, perversions become obsessed by paranoid theories and destructive ideals. These are some of the most chaotic and unpredictable civilizations.
* [[Solipsist]] (corrupted hermit): Solipsist civilizations believe that nothing matters except what happens in their own mind. Though often harmless they can cause great suffering because they never worry about the consequences of their actions.
== Technology == There are six broad classes of [[Galactic technology]], each corresponding to a particular philosophy. Each of the Ancient Races generally uses a single class. Within a class, technological artifacts and knowledge are compatible with each other. Not so across classes.
The six classes are:
* [[Megatech]]: The technology of terraforming and creating megastructures such as world-ships, associated with the community aspect. * [[Recyclist]]: The technology based on gluing together various bits of other technologies, associated with the independence aspect. * [[Mechanist]]: The technology of machines and cybernetics, associated with the knowledge aspect. * [[Psionic]]: The technology based on conscious energy, associated with the spirituality aspect. (This technology does not have physical star-travel.) * [[Biotech]]: The technology of life (generally carbon-based), associated with the evolution aspect. * [[Archeotech]]: The technology based on precursor civilizations such as the [[Majellen]], associated with the tradition aspect.
== Population == There is a wide distribution of population sizes among the Ancient Races. A few races have more than 10 trillion individuals; many have less than 10 million. This table shows the rough distribution:
{| class="wikitable" |- !Population !No. of Races !Notes |- |100 trillion |1 |The [[Mu Nai]] have been expanding for the last 50 million years. |- |10 trillion |3 |The [[Reenu]] are one of these. |- |1 trillion |7 | |- |100 billion |19 |Population limit for cultured races. [[B-nine]] are in this category. |- |10 billion |50 | |- |1 billion |133 | |- |100 million |352 | |- |10 million |936 | |- |1 million |2,487 | |- |> 1 million |6,608 | |- |}
=== Savage and Cultured Civilizations === Over time, civilizations chafed under the population controls and many openly subverted them. The Archons, in concert with Oracus and Domina, separated them into two classes. ''Savage'' civilizations were allowed to reproduce at will, but were not protected from predation or even sport. In contrast, ''cultured'' civilizations maintained their original population limits but were protected from harm by the Archons.
Most of the constructive civilizations are cultured, while most (but not all) of the destructive civilizations are savage.
== Primary Races == There are more than a thousand different races in the galaxy; these are the most common and numerous:
=== Constructive Races === {| class="wikitable" |- !width="150pt"|Race !Domain !Alignment !Tech !width="500pt"|Notes |- ![[Aestari]] |[[Nebular]] |[[Hermit]] |[[Archeotech]] |One of the oldest and most respected civilizations; they helped to forge the peace after the [[Galactic Civil War]]. |- ![[B-nine]] |[[Ferroelectric]] |[[Federation]] |[[Mechanist]] |A cybernetic species created by the [[A-six]] and later emancipated. |- ![[Cenotropes]] |[[Oxygenia]] |[[Federation]] |[[Archeotech]] |Cenotropes guard the systems around the tomb of Oracus and Domina. |- ![[Efreet]] |[[Hydrogenia (domain)|Hydrogenia]] |[[Archivist]] |[[Archeotech]] |The Efreet are in a war against the [[Jax]], who are efficient predators. |- ![[Erebien]] |[[Oxygenia]] |[[Republic]] |[[Mechanist]] |An idealistic and energetic civilization, though sometimes prone to hubris. |- ![[Illianloo]] |[[Hydrogenia (domain)|Hydrogenia]] |[[Foundation]] |[[Archeotech]] |The Illianloo are an ancient civilization. |- ![[Iocrym]] |[[Carbosilicate]] |[[Republic]] |[[Mechanist]] |The Iocrym were created to monitor new ascensions. |- ![[Oduduwa]] |[[Photosynthic]] |[[Seeker]] |[[Biotech]] | |- ![[Tesiphons]] |[[Oxygenia]] |[[Uplifter]] |[[Biotech]] |A young civilization that has recently uplifted many species. |- ![[Tor Quan]] |[[Oxygenia]] |[[Competitor]] |[[Biotech]] |The Tor Quan and Erebien are brother races, but the Tor Quan often feel eclipsed by their siblings. |- |}
=== Destructive Races === {| class="wikitable" |- !width="150pt"|Race !Domain !Alignment !Tech !width="500pt"|Notes |- ![[Cryson]] |[[Oxygenia]] |[[Sterelizer]] |[[Megatech]] |Created by the [[Somatons]] but now disowned. |- ![[Grome]] |[[Oxygenia]] |[[Empire]] |[[Mechanist]] |Uplifted by the Tesiphons but rebelled and now a savage empire. |- ![[Hael]] |[[Monomorphia]] |[[Solipsist]] |[[Psionic]] |A clonal colony that feeds on radiation and can control some kinds of nervous systems. |- ![[Illianloo Regressors]] |[[Hydrogenia (domain)|Hydrogenia]] |[[Corrector]] |[[Archeotech]] |A sect that split from the [[Illianloo]]. |- ![[Jax]] |[[Hydrogenia (domain)|Hydrogenia]] |[[Megalomaniac]] |[[Biotech]] |A hunter-killer species that evolved eating the [[Illianloo]] and now threatens the [[Efreet]]. |- ![[Mu Nai]] |[[Oxygenia]] |[[Collective]] |[[Mechanist]] |A savage species that seeks expansion. |- ![[Onawa Trome]] |[[Photosynthic]] |[[Collective]] |[[Biotech]] |A hunter species. |- ![[Reenu]] |[[Photosynthic]] |[[Empire]] |[[Archeotech]] |A species that expands relentlessly. |- ![[Underdark Keeper]] |[[Oxygenia]] |[[Cryptologue]] |[[Mechanist]] | |- ![[Xon Caol]] |[[Oxygenia]] |[[Perversion]] |[[Biotech]] | |- |}
== See Also == * [[Ancient Races (design notes)]] * [[Civilization alignment]] * [[Domains of life]] * [[Galactic origins]] * [[Galactic technology]]
{{TEC}}

* [[Sterilizer]] (corrupted uplifter): Sterilizers and uplifters have a similar goal: to create a better universe. Sterilizers destroy flawed cultures rather than help to improve them.

There are six broad classes of technology, each corresponding to a particular philosophy. Each of the [[Ancient Races]] generally uses a single class. Within a class, technological artifacts and knowledge are compatible with each other. Not so across classes.
The six classes are:
* [[Archeotech]]: The technology based on precursor civilizations such as the [[Majellen]], associated with the tradition aspect. (Archeotech is superior to Mechanist and Megatech.) * [[Biotech]]: The technology of life (generally carbon-based), associated with the evolution aspect. (Biotech is superior to Archeotech and Recyclist.) * [[Mechanist]]: The technology of machines and cybernetics, associated with the knowledge aspect. (Mechanist is superior to Recyclist and Biotech.) * [[Megatech]]: The technology of terraforming and creating megastructures such as world-ships, associated with the community aspect. (Megatech is superior to Biotech and Mechanist.) * [[Psionic]]: The technology based on conscious energy, associated with the spirituality aspect. (This technology does not have physical star-travel.) * [[Recyclist]]: The technology based on gluing together various bits of other technologies, associated with the independence aspect. (Recyclist is superior to Megatech and Archeotech.)
== See Also == * [[Alignment]] * [[Ancient Races]] * [[Tech tree]]
{{TEC}}

The Serenus Arm is one of two major spiral arms in the galaxy.
The principal sovereigns in the Serenus Arm are [[Erebien]], [[Tor Quans]], and [[Efreet]]. There are also some areas controlled by [[Grome]], [[Reenu]], and [[Jax]], and there is often conflict among them all.
== Points of Interest ==
* [[Imralis]]: The Aestari refuge of Imralis is hidden in a small and unassuming nebula at the extreme end of the Serenus Arm. The Archon of the Aestari is sometimes found here.
== See Also == * [[Abbadon Arm]] * [[Ancient Races]] * [[The Vault of the Galaxy]]
{{TEC}}

== See Also == * [[Biotech (design notes)]] * [[Galactic technology]]
{{TEC}}

== See Also == * [[Mechanist (design notes)]] * [[Galactic technology]]
{{TEC}}

== See Also == * [[Archeotech (design notes)]] * [[Galactic technology]]
{{TEC}}

{| class="wikitable" |- !width="150pt"|Domain |width="300pt"|[[Oxygenia]] |- !width="150pt"|Ancestry |width="300pt"|Evolved from [[Daazhen]] |- !Compact |Cultured |- !Alignment |[[Republic]] |- !Technology |[[Mechanist]] |- !Emergence |19.20.123.722 |- |}
Perpetual optimists, the Erebien strive to perfect their civilization in a galaxy that often seems illogical.
Though they are a relatively young race, they have the respect of their elders, a fact which annoys their sibling race, the [[Tor Quan]].
== History == The Erebien emerged from the [[Daazhen]] after the end of the [[Oracus War]].
== Biology == Exoskeletal, human-sized; they appear as a head on top of four multi-jointed limbs, each of which can serve as either leg or arm.
== Economy ==
== Language & Culture ==
== Key Places ==
== Sects & Organizations == === Archons === The Archons of the Erebien are very involved in the civilization.
=== Erebien Military === The defenders of the Erebien.
== Stations & Starships ==
== Allies & Enemies == === Humanity === The Erebien want to spare humanity. They regret that the [[Anunnaki]] were exterminated and feel that they could have done better. They dismiss the [[Iocrym]] and the [[Cenotropes]] as backward-looking.
=== Tor Quan === The [[Tor Quan]] are the Erebien's brother species and they have always had a competitive relationship with them.
=== Conflict with the [[Reenu]] === The [[Reenu]] have an expansionist empire that often encroaches on Erebien systems. Though the conflict has endured since the founding of the Reenu Empire it has increased in intensity in the last few trisems. Some believe the Reenu can no longer be contained and must be exterminated, though the Erebien archons do not agree.
=== Conflict with the [[Jax]] === The [[Jax]] are an intelligent predator species that mainly hunt the [[Efreet]] and their interests. The Erebien, though sometimes a target, try to contain the Jax to help the Efreet (whom they consider a strong ally).
=== Conflict with the [[Grome]] === The Erebien have a complicated relationship with the [[Grome]]. Though they officially disapprove of the Grome's expansionist behavior, the Erebien find the Grome useful when they threaten the [[Tor Quan]].
== See Also == * [[Ancient Races]]
{{TEC}}

A republic is an [[alignment]] of Galactic civilization characterized by the aspects of community, knowledge, and evolution.
== Community == Republics have a high-degree of social cohesion. The individuals of a republic feel that they are part of something greater and willingly sacrifice some personal gain for the good of the civilization. Whereas [[federations]] achieve social cohesion through a complex balance of power among disparate groups, republics tend to have a homogenous population that shares many key values.
In some cases this homogeneity leads to a belief in the civilization's superiority over others; in extreme cases it can turn into xenophobia.
== Knowledge == Republics generally believe in the importance of science and objective knowledge.
== Evolution == Republican society is seldom static; republics strive to improve their civilization and adapt it to a changing universe.
Republics often rank themselves against other civilizations, believing that some civilizations are better than others according to concrete and measurable criteria. Some republics distrust civilizations that cling to their past traditions, but most are inward-focused.
== Technology == Republics tend to adopt [[biotech]], [[mechanist]], or [[megatech]] technologies.
== Republics == * [[Erebien]] * [[Iocrym]]
== See Also == * [[Civilization alignment]]
{{TEC}}

This article lists the different methods for generating power:
; [[Antimatter]] : Antimatter power involves the regulated combination of matter and antimatter. Antimatter fuel can be obtained from [[chronimium]], [[pteracnium]], and [[xenotite]].
; [[Combustion]] : One of the most primitive sorts of power generation, this method creates heat by rapid oxydization of some fuel. This is the principal behind hydrocarbon power generation as well as the chemical process of species of the [[oxygenia]] domain.
; [[Dark energy]] : This mysterious power source is available only to [[archons]], [[hierodules]], and [[Domina]] & [[Oracus]].
; [[Gravitic energy]] : Gravitic energy can be harvested at large-scale around neutron stars and black holes. At small-scale it is possible to use [[nanosingularities]] in a [[pseudocore]] armature to generate power.
; [[Nuclear fission]] : Power generation through splitting heavy elements. This process requires fuels like [[uranium]] and [[plutonium]].
; [[Nuclear fusion]] : Power generation through fusing of light elements. This process requires some heavy isotopes of hydrogen and helium. [[Helium regolith]] is a common raw material.
; [[Preon energy]] : Some of the [[Ancient Races]] have developed technology to split protons and neutrons into their constituent quarks.
; [[Solar power]] : This method converts photons into energy; this is the primary power generation method of [[photosynthic]] species. Some human sovereigns and alien species build large-scale structure to harness solar power.
; [[Zero-point energy]] : This method uses [[hadron archeolith]] as fuel and exotic vacuums as a ground-state.
== See Also == * [[Materials]]
{{TEC}}

The Bushido Corporation is a small, innovative weapons designer and manufacturer. They are a subsidiary of [[Honoku-Tomashi]].
{{TEC}}

revision.text:
OmniDefense Systems (ODS) is a medium-sized corporation specializing in the manufacture of [[autons]]. They are a subsidiary of [[Earth Industries Conglomerate]].
ODS started manufacturing autons for Corporate defense in the late 2290’s. Though they did not invent the concept of an autonomous escort ship, they were the first to perfect the sophisticated algorithms required. Previous models had suffered from glitches that sometimes led to friendly-fire incidents.
In 2386, ODS began selling a version of their low-end defense auton to consumers interested in personal defense. Although initially controversial, sales of this consumer model far exceeded expectations.
In 2389, ODS produced the first AutoSentinel model, and since that time ODS has derived more than half its revenue from consumer sales.
OmniDefense Systems was purchased by Earth Industries in a hostile takeover in 2391.
{{TEC}}
